comment: Dr. Bradley overall is a pretty good professor! Her lectures are fun and interesting while also being cohesive with the objectives. Attendance is not mandatory, but no textbook exists, so the lectures are the only way to learn the material. She's a tough grader and does not provide specific feedback, so it can be hard to improve writing. (BLCK3300)

I wish i read more of the assigned readings. Class would've been more engaging that way. In African American Literature there are a lot of good discussions to be had so it helps to have read the material. We watched music videos, different black media and even ended up dancing one time. I really enjoyed this class and wish it was longer!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Literally such random quizzes and she randomly decided when she was going to account for attendance after saying she wasn't going to. I got a B in the class because her quizzes her 3 true or false questions that so you either fail, get a 75, or a 100. She was a cool person but I don't think I aligned with her teaching style.

I actually really enjoyed this course and professor. Her lectures were amazing and so interactive. She made this class fun to go to. We have these assignments each week called "Friday reviews". You have to make sure you're taking good notes and really paying attention to the lectures for these. Take her!

Dr. Bradley is a really cool teacher. Mainly the hard part for me was her true/false questions. Sounds crazy right? But, some of her questions are quite tricky on Friday reviews. Dr. Bradley always sent out the best messages every week and it makes you feel better knowing that someone understands. Although she is a tough grader, she is the best !!!

I really really loved this class. This class can be an easy A if you do all the work she assigns. She can be a tough grader, but if you really put in the effort then you'll end with an A. Take this class!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: There are 3 tests, 3 discussion essay posts, and 3 Friday Reviews. Make sure you read; the class is so much easier when you read. She's going to make sure you succeed, but you're going to have to put the effort in too. I definitely recommend taking this class with Professor Bradley.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: There are 3 tests, 3 discussion essay posts, and Friday mini-quizzes. Professor Bradley is amazing and cares about her students. You have to work for your grade, but she works with you to make sure you do well. I definitely recommend her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Bradley is a special teacher to me. Ive never had a teacher that grades your papers and gives very effective (sometimes harsh) feedback then allows you to resubmit the assignment after you make corrections. Her teaching style works and makes you feel like a better writer. She wont leave you hanging. If you reach out she will help. I RECOMMEND
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Prof. Bradley is the BEST! She has been my favorite class so far. African Am. Lit opened my eyes on so many different things, and I loved the entire experience. Everyone should take this class; it's funny, life-changing, and overall a character builder. Get the books, and do the readings! This is not a gimme grade, but an A is attainable with work!

One of the best professors I have taken at KSU! While there is a alot of work we do during the semester, the knowledge you receive is worth all of it. She engages you to participate in class discussions & teaches us about AA Literature beyond the curriculum. 3 tests, Weekly Friday Reviews/Quizzes & Attendance makes up the grade. BE INTERACTIVE!

Dr. Bradley is awesome! Most of her lectures are just broken into small groups where we talk about what we read and then at the end of class we all come together and discuss. She has 3 major papers and then her final is a research paper. She really makes sure you understand the material and helps you with your writing whenever you need it.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. Bradley is hilarious and takes interest in her students. Class participation is a must! I did poorly on her exams. True or false is her favorite and she's tricky. If you also struggle with this, make sure you shine on the essay portions of her test. I don't feel my grade reflected how much I learned. If only grades didn't matter...
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Bradley is extremely passionate and genuine in her approach. She expects a lot from students and will challenge the way you think. The work load is heavy but the way she engages with the material makes it easier to digest. If you communicate and meet her halfway she will go above and beyond for you. Highly recommend taking one of her courses!

The class is basically all discussion which was really interesting. We read 6 books, the tests were on details in each book. She might test on what was discussed in class so take notes. I took this class in the summer and I expected a lot of writing, but we only wrote about 3 essays which weren't a major grade.

OMG if you want a good teacher that genuinely cares about her students ANDher teaching, take her! Super cool and easy to talk with. Class is very interactive and engaging. You will need the book! She is only tough if you don't take the class seriously. Take her!

Professor Bradley is AMAZING. She was my favorite class, her lectures are so engaging and keep you on the edge of your seat. I had her for Survey of African American Literature. You must keep up with readings or you will piss her off. Great teacher but she will not accept anything less than your best. You will not be disapointed, PROMISE.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Want to learn about black culture, historical and contemporary? Take Dr. B! Inspirational while relating course context to students. Clear cut  w detailed syllabus and feedback. If she was not leaving KSU I would take ALL of the classes she offered. Meticulous grader, will make you work for that A all while gaining relevant knowledge.

Dr. Bradley is a awesome professor, she is straight to the point with no filter. I enjoyed attending her lectures. Dr. Bradley's knowledge never seem to amaze me.  I am honored to have been one of last classes at KSU.

Makes class interesting, but I was never really clear about what we were learning. In this case the relevance between hip hop and civil rights.. The readings only helped a little on the quizes but otherwise meant nothing. Two main papers which account for most of the grade. I wouldn't take her again just because the subject to learn felt irrelivant

She's hilarious and down to earth, but her expectations for students are extreme! The last paper is like minimum 13 pages which sucks considering our other responsibilities and finals. Be ready to read and write an essay for each quiz (3). She's extremely smart, but should consider her students "degreeworks"--we're still learning scholars.

Dr. Bradley is a great professor. Her lectures are interesting and she is clear about what she is looking for from her students. She is easy to talk to and you can tell that she loves teaching. I would definitely recommend taking her.

Best class I have ever took in college. Dr. Bradley is extremely cool and DTE. Not only did I learn a lot in her class, but it changed my viewpoint on a lot of things. This class is very challenging; a lot of reading and a lot of essay writing, but it is well worth it.

Dr. Bradley was overall a great teacher. She kept class interesting and was always helpful when needed. Takes a long time to grade papers, but gives you good feedback. READ BOOK for pop quizzes- main reason I didnt make an A. 3 papers, finals worth the most,half of your grade. Overall she was great
She is nice but the class is not that easy. You have to write a few essays. You can get away with not reading the books, but going to class is extremely important!

She is knowledgeable about the subjects she teaches. He grading is not always consistent. She has her own way of doing things and discussion is always interesting. However, I'm not sure she enjoys when people disagree with  her.

Great professor. Class and discussions are interesting. There are 4 or 5 books that will need to be read throughout the semester. Your ONLY allowed to miss 2 classes. The work is not too hard. She's willing to help. Responds to emails quickly. Take her! I was at a 77 but ended up getting an 80. I actually looked forward to her class on Fridays! :)

It's cool if you just want a discussion class. As far as learning about writing, we don't. So you don't know how well you'll do on the first few assignments, and she grades pretty roughly. She's really nice and funny, but I learned absolutely nothing.
Shes awesome! we talk about the walking dead every week. you do have to do a lot of writing but she is a good teacher and will help you
Professor Bradley is awesome! Her class is interesting and hardly ever boring. She is always willing to help and her directions for assignments are very clear. Highly recommended!

She is awesome! I had her for English 1101 and 1102. Her class is very very very interesting! Not only do you learn but its fun, which is hard to find in professors. I wish I could take her for every English class.
She's really cool and you can learn a lot, but it's a lot of work. If you're planning on majoring in English I would definitely take this class.
I loved her! She was hilarious! Try to get her if you can.
